module.title: Story Point Estimation Mastery
module.description: Master the art of relative sizing in agile development

exercises.title: Abstract Comparisons
exercises.description: Learn relative sizing with abstract items
exercises.details: Start with simple abstract concepts to understand relative effort without real-world bias.

startScreen.instructions: You'll be presented with abstract items like "a grain of sand," "a pebble," "a boulder," and "a mountain." Your task is to arrange them by relative effort to move, then assign story points.

ui.mindsetReminder: Remember: Story points are about relative effort, not absolute time. A '3' is roughly three times the effort of a '1'.

exercises.title: User Stories
exercises.description: Apply sizing to real user stories
exercises.details: Practice with realistic user stories from a typical web application development scenario.

startScreen.instructions: You'll work with realistic user stories from a typical web application. First arrange them by relative complexity, then assign story points (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13) based on complexity, effort, and uncertainty.

exercises.title: Core Principles
exercises.details: Test your knowledge with an interactive quiz covering fundamental story point principles.

startScreen.instructions: Complete an interactive quiz covering the fundamental principles of story point estimation, then review a comprehensive summary of everything you've learned.

preview.title: What You'll Cover:
items: ✓ The three factors: complexity, effort, uncertainty

exercises.title: Story Readiness Assessment
exercises.description: Learn when and how to handle stories that aren't ready for sizing
exercises.details: Master the critical skill of identifying stories that need more work before they can be estimated. Learn to recognize stories that are too vague, too large, or too small.

categories.title: Ready to Size
categories.description: Stories with clear requirements and appropriate scope

categories.title: Too Vague - Need More Info
categories.description: Stories lacking sufficient detail or with unclear requirements

categories.title: Too Large - Break Down
categories.description: Stories that are too complex and need decomposition

categories.title: Too Small - Combine
categories.description: Stories that are over-decomposed and should be merged

startScreen.instructions:
In this advanced exercise, you'll practice the critical skill of story readiness assessment.

1. DRAG each story from the list on the right into the appropriate category bucket on the left.

2. CONSIDER whether each story has enough detail to estimate, is appropriately sized, or needs additional work.

3. THINK about the three key factors: Is it clear what needs to be done? Is the scope appropriate? Are there any blockers?

Your goal is to identify which stories are ready for estimation and what needs to happen to prepare the others.
